conclusion: Understanding principles of refraction and refractive indices relationship in water.
Point light source S emits monochromatic light A and B.
Light A is refracted at the boundary of the small circular area.
Light B is refracted at the boundary of the large circular area.
Refractive index of water to monochromatic light A is n_1.
Refractive index of water to monochromatic light B is n_2.
Using Snell's law, sin(theta_1) = n_1/n_2 for light A.
Using Snell's law, sin(theta_2) = n_2/n_1 for light B.
Angle of incidence for light A is theta_1.
Angle of incidence for light B is theta_2.
Since sin(theta_1) = sin(theta_2), conclude sin(theta_1) = sin(theta_2).
Sine value of refraction angle of monochromatic light B at boundary of small circular area is sin(theta_2).
